intro: Dryandra nobilis subsp. fragrans, commonly known as the sweet-scented dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, recurved leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its fragrant, nectar-rich inflorescences that attract native pollinators. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
